intro: Cheiridopsis marlothii, commonly known as the marlothii ice plant, is a succulent species native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the mesembs, and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in arid gardens and rockeries.
